attr.name: zimbraCertAuthorityKeySelfSigned
attr.desc: Please see the documentation for the attribute zimbraCertAuthorityCertSelfSigned. In addition, please note that this attribute is provided at install for convenience during a test install without real certs issued by well known CAs. If you choose to create your own CA for your production uses, please note that it is a bad idea to store your CA-s private key in LDAP, as this data maybe read from zimbraGlobalConfig in the clear.

attr.name: zimbraCertAuthorityCertSelfSigned
attr.desc: When creating self-signed SSL certs during an install, we also create a local Certificate Authority (CA) to sign these SSL certs. This local CA-s own cert is then added to different applications "trusted CA-s" list/store. This attribute should not be used in a system with real certs issued by well known CAs.

attr.deprecateDesc: Installed skin list is a per server property, the list is now generated by directory scan of skin files

attr.desc: Indicates the account is a resource used by the system such as spam accounts or Notebook accounts.

attr.name: zimbraPasswordLockoutEnabled
attr.desc: whether or not account lockout is enabled.

attr.desc: how long an account is locked out. Use 0 to lockout an account until admin resets it

attr.name: zimbraPasswordLockoutMaxFailures
attr.desc: number of consecutive failed login attempts until an account is locked out

attr.name: zimbraPasswordLockoutFailureLifetime
attr.desc: the duration after which old consecutive failed login attempts are purged from the list, even though no successful authentication has occurred

attr.name: zimbraPasswordLockoutLockedTime
attr.desc: the time at which an account was locked

attr.name: zimbraPasswordLockoutFailureTime
attr.desc: this attribute contains the timestamps of each of the consecutive authentication failures made on an account

attr.name: zimbraPrefOutOfOfficeFromDate
attr.desc: out of office notifications (if enabled) are sent only if current date is after this date

attr.name: zimbraPrefOutOfOfficeUntilDate
attr.desc: out of office notifications (if enabled) are sent only if current date is before this date

attr.name: zimbraPrefOutOfOfficeCacheDuration
attr.desc: server remembers addresses to which notifications have been sent for this interval, and does not send duplicate notifications in this interval

attr.name: zimbraPrefOutOfOfficeDirectAddress
attr.desc: per RFC 3834 no out of office notifications are sent if recipients address is not directly specified in the To/CC headers - for this check, we check to see if To/CC contained accounts address, aliases, canonical address. But when external accounts are forwarded to Zimbra, and you want notifications sent to messages that contain their external address in To/Cc, add those address, then you can specify those external addresses here.

attr.name: zimbraHttpProxyURL
attr.desc: the http proxy URL to connect to when making outgoing connections (Zimlet proxy, RSS/ATOM feeds, etc)

attr.name: zimbraPasswordMinNumericChars

attr.desc: TRUE if we should set a reply-to header

attr.desc: Mailboxes in which the current account in archived. Multi-value attr with eg values { user-2006@example.com.archive, user-2007@example.com.archive } that tells us that user@example.com has been archived into those two mailboxes.

attr.name: zimbraArchiveMailFrom
attr.desc: Address to which archive message bounces should be sent. Typically could be an admin account. This is global across all domains.

attr.name: zimbraArchiveAccountNameTemplate
attr.desc: An account or CoS setting - typically only in CoS - that tells the archiving system how to derive the archive mailbox name. ID, USER, DATE, and DOMAIN are expanded.

attr.name: zimbraArchiveAccountDateTemplate
attr.desc: An account or CoS setting that works with the name template that allows you to dictate the date format used in the name template. This is a Java SimpleDateFormat specifier. The default is an LDAP generalized time format:

attr.name: zimbraPrefIdentityId
attr.desc: Unique ID for an identity

attr.name: zimbraSmtpSendAddOriginatingIP

attr.name: zimbraFeatureTasksEnabled
attr.desc: whether to allow use of tasks feature

attr.name: zimbraSyncWindowSize
attr.desc: The maximum batch size for each ZimbraSync transaction. Default value of 0 means to follow client requested size. If set to any positive integer, the value will be the maximum number of items to sync even if client requests more. This setting affects all sync categories including email, contacts, calendar and tasks.

attr.name: zimbraAccountExtraObjectClass
attr.desc: Object classes to add when creating a zimbra account object. Useful if you want to add sambaSamAccount etc to zimbra accounts.

attr.name: zimbraPrefCalendarDayHourStart
attr.desc: hour of day that the day view should start at (1=1 AM, 8=8 AM, etc)

attr.name: zimbraPrefLocale
attr.desc: user locale preference, e.g. en_US Whenever the server looks for the user locale, it will first look for zimbraPrefLocale, if it is not set then it will fallback to the current mechanism of looking for zimbraLocale in the various places for a user. zimbraLocale is the non end-user attribute that specifies which locale an object defaults to, it is not an end-user setting.

attr.name: zimbraImapSSLDisabledCapability

attr.name: zimbraPrefClientType

attr.name: zimbraDataSourcePollingInterval
attr.desc: Prior to 6.0.0: The time interval between automated data imports for a data source, or all data sources owned by an account. If unset or 0, the data source will not be scheduled for automated polling. Since 6.0.0: Deprecated on account/cos since 6.0.0. Values on account/cos are migrated to protocol specific zimbraDataSource{proto}PollingInterval attributes. 1. if zimbraDataSourcePollingInterval is set on data source, use it 2. otherwise use the zimbraDataSource{Proto}PollingInterval on account/cos 3. if zimbraDataSource{Proto}PollingInterval is not set on account/cos, use 0, which means no automated polling.

attr.name: zimbraQuotaWarnMessage
attr.defaultCOSValue: From: Postmaster <postmaster@${RECIPIENT_DOMAIN}>${NEWLINE}To: ${RECIPIENT_NAME} <${RECIPIENT_ADDRESS}>${NEWLINE}Subject: Quota warning${NEWLINE}Date: ${DATE}${NEWLINE}Content-Type: text/plain${NEWLINE}${NEWLINE}Your mailbox size has reached ${MBOX_SIZE_MB}MB, which is over ${WARN_PERCENT}% of your ${QUOTA_MB}MB quota.${NEWLINE}Please delete some messages to avoid exceeding your quota.${NEWLINE}
attr.desc: Quota warning message template.

attr.name: zimbraDomainStatus
attr.desc:
domain status. enum values are akin to those of zimbraAccountStatus
zimbraAccountStatus values: active - active lockout - no login until lockout duration is over locked - no login maintenance - no login, no delivery(try again, no bouncing) pending - no login, no delivery(bouncing mails), Account behavior is like closed, except that when the status is being set to pending, account addresses are not removed from distribution lists. The use case is for hosted. New account creation based on invites that are not completed until user accepts TOS on account creation confirmation page. closed - no login, no delivery(bouncing mails) all addresses (account main email and all aliases) of the account are removed from all distribution lists.
zimbraDomainStatus values: all values for zimbraAccountStatus (except for lockout, see mapping below) suspended - maintenance + no creating/deleting/modifying accounts/DLs under the domain. shutdown - suspended + cannot modify domain attrs + cannot delete the domain Indicating server is doing major and lengthy maintenance work on the domain, e.g. renaming the domain and moving LDAP enteries. Modification and deletion of the domain can only be done internally by the server when it is safe to release the domain, they cannot be done in admin console or zmprov.
How zimbraDomainStatus affects account behavior : ------------------------------------- zimbraDomainStatus account behavior ------------------------------------- active zimbraAccountStatus locked zimbraAccountStatus if it is maintenance or pending or closed, else locked maintenance zimbraAccountStatus if it is pending or closed, else maintenance suspended zimbraAccountStatus if it is pending or closed, else maintenance shutdown zimbraAccountStatus if it is pending or closed, else maintenance closed closed

attr.name: zimbraReverseProxyIPLoginLimit
attr.desc: Sets the upper limit on logins from a remote IP via POP or IMAP to this proxy server after which login is rejected with an appropriate protocol specific bye response. This counter is cumulative for all users that appear to the proxy to be logging in from the same IP address. If multiple users appear to the proxy to be logging in from the same IP address (usual with NATing), then each of the different users login will contribute to increasing the hit counter for that IP address, and when the counter eventually exceeds the limit, then the connections from that IP address will be throttled. Therefore, all users from the same IP will contribute to (and be affected by) this counter. Logins using all protocols (POP3/POP3S/IMAP/IMAPS) will affect this counter (the counter is aggregate for all protocols, *not* separate). If this value is set to 0, then no limiting will take place for any IP.

attr.name: zimbraReverseProxyIPLoginLimitTime
attr.desc: Sets the time-to-live for the hit counter for IP based login throttling. If time is set to 3600 and limit is set to 1000, then it means that NGINX should not allow more than 1000 users to log in via the proxy from the same IP, within the time interval of an hour. The semantics for such a configuration would then be: allow maximum 1000 users per hour from any given IP address.

attr.name: zimbraReverseProxyUserLoginLimit
attr.desc: Limit how many times a user can login via the proxy. Setting limit to 100 and time to 3600 means: allow maximum 100 logins per hour for any user. As with the ip counterparts, the user hit counter and timeout are cumulative for all protocols. Also, for a given users login, both counters are checked in succession, with the IP counter being checked first. A login may be rejected (throttled) because the IP is over-usage, or because the login name itself is over-usage. A value of 0 indicates that no throttling will take place for any user.

attr.name: zimbraReverseProxyUserLoginLimitTime
attr.desc: Sets the time-to-live for the hit counter for per user login throttling.

attr.name: zimbraHsmPolicy
attr.desc: The policy that determines which mail items get moved to secondary storage during HSM. Each value specifies a comma-separated list of item types and the search query used to select items to move. See the spec for <SearchRequest> for the complete list of item types and query.txt for the search query spec.

attr.name: zimbraMailTrustedIP
attr.desc:
In our web app, AJAX and standard html client, we have support for adding the HTTP client IP address as X-Originating-IP in an outbound message. We also use the HTTP client IP address in our logging.
In the case of standard client making connections to the SOAP layer, the JSP layer tells the SOAP layer in a http header what the remote HTTP client address is. In the case where nginx or some other proxy layer is fronting our webapps, the proxy tells the SOAP/JSP layers in a http header what the real HTTP client s address is.
Our SOAP/JSP layers will trust the client/proxy only if the IP address of the client/proxy is one of the IPs listed in this attribute.

attr.desc: domain mandatory mail html signature

attr.name: zimbraPrefMailFoldersCheckedForNewMsgIndicator
attr.desc: a list of comma separated folder ids of all folders used to count for showing a new message indicator icon for the account, useful in UIs managing multiple accounts: desktop and family mailboxes.

attr.name: zimbraPrefSpellIgnoreWord
attr.desc: List of words to ignore when checking spelling. The word list of an account includes the words specified for its cos and domain.

attr.name: zimbraResponseHeader
attr.desc: Custom response headers. For example, can be used to add a P3P header for user agents to understand the sites privacy policy. Note: the value MUST be the entire header line (e.g. X-Foo: Bar).

attr.name: zimbraErrorReportUrl
attr.desc: URL for posting error report popped up in WEB client

attr.name: zimbraPrefDisabledZimlets
attr.desc: zimlets user does not want to see in the UI

attr.name: zimbraSmtpRestrictEnvelopeFrom
attr.desc: If TRUE, the address for MAIL FROM in the SMTP session will always be set to the email address of the account. If FALSE, the address will be the value of the Sender or From header in the outgoing message, in that order.

attr.name: zimbraCalendarCalDavDefaultCalendarId
attr.desc: Id of calendar folder to advertise as the default calendar to CalDAV client.

attr.name: zimbraPrefItemsPerVirtualPage
attr.desc: number of messages/conversations per virtual page

attr.name: zimbraImapShutdownGraceSeconds
attr.desc: number of seconds to wait before forcing IMAP server shutdown

attr.name: zimbraPop3ShutdownGraceSeconds
attr.desc: number of seconds to wait before forcing POP3 server shutdown

attr.name: zimbraLmtpShutdownGraceSeconds
attr.desc: number of seconds to wait before forcing LMTP server shutdown

attr.name: zimbraDataSourceConnectTimeout
attr.desc: Connect timeout in seconds for the data source

attr.name: zimbraDataSourceReadTimeout
attr.desc: Read timeout in seconds

attr.name: zimbraImapMaxRequestSize
attr.desc: maximum size of IMAP request in bytes excluding literal data

attr.name: zimbraContactHiddenAttributes
attr.desc: Comma separated list of Contact attributes that should be hidden from clients and export of contacts.

attr.name: zimbraCalendarResourceDoubleBookingAllowed
attr.desc: whether calendar reasources can be double booked

attr.name: zimbraContactEmailFields
attr.desc: Comma separates list of attributes in contact object to search for email addresses when generating auto-complete contact list. The same set of fields are used for GAL contacts as well because LDAP attributes for GAL objects are mapped to Contact compatible attributes via zimbraGalLdapAttrMap.

attr.name: zimbraPrefCalendarApptAllowAtendeeEdit
attr.desc: Whether to allow attendees to make local edits to appointments. The change is only on the attendees copy of the message and changes from the organizer will overwrite the local changes.

attr.name: zimbraPrefContactsDisableAutocompleteOnContactGroupMembers
attr.desc: Disables autocomplete matching against the members email address.

attr.name: zimbraPrefAutoCompleteQuickCompletionOnComma
attr.desc: whether to end auto-complete on comma

attr.name: zimbraCalendarShowResourceTabs
attr.desc: whether to show Find Locations and Find Resources tabs for editing appointments

attr.name: zimbraGalAlwaysIncludeLocalCalendarResources
attr.desc: When set to TRUE, GAL search will always include local calendar resources regardless of zimbraGalMode.

attr.name: zimbraAuthTokenValidityValueEnabled
attr.desc: Whether auth token validity value checking should be performed during auth token validation. See description for zimbraAuthTokenValidityValue.

attr.name: zimbraPrefDefaultPrintFontSize
attr.desc: default font size

attr.name: zimbraMailPurgeBatchSize
attr.desc: Maximum number of messages to delete from a folder during a single purge operation. If the limit is exceeded, the mailbox is purged again at the end of the purge cycle until all qualifying messages are purged.

attr.name: zimbraMailEmptyFolderBatchSize
attr.desc: Maximum number of messages to delete during a single transaction when emptying a folder. If the limit is exceeded, the folder is emptied in multiple transactions. Each transaction deletes this number of messages.

attr.name: zimbraBasicAuthRealm
attr.desc: Realm for the basic auth challenge (WWW-Authenticate) header

attr.name: zimbraMailAllowReceiveButNotSendWhenOverQuota
attr.desc: If TRUE, a mailbox that exceeds its quota is still allowed to receive mail, but is not allowed to send.

attr.name: zimbraAmavisQuarantineAccount
attr.desc: When a virus is detected quarantine message to this account

attr.name: zimbraAdminAccessControlMech
attr.desc: access control mechanism for admin access acl: ACL based access control (a.k.a. delegated admin). global: allows only global admins.

attr.name: zimbraPrefContactsExpandAppleContactGroups
attr.desc: Expand the contact groups in Apple Address Book format to Zimbra format over CardDAV.

attr.name: zimbraPrefCalendarWorkingHours
attr.desc: working hours for each day of the week

attr.name: zimbraDataSourceImportOnly
attr.desc: indicates that this datasource is used for one way (incoming) import vs. two-way sync

attr.name: zimbraDataSourceAuthMechanism
attr.desc: Which SASL authentication mechanism to use for authenticating to IMAP server.

attr.name: zimbraDataSourceAuthorizationId
attr.desc: authorizationId for SASL authentication

attr.name: zimbraFeaturePeopleSearchEnabled
attr.desc: whether people search feature is enabled

attr.name: zimbraGalLdapValueMap
attr.desc: LDAP Gal attribute to contact value mapping. Each value is in the format of {gal contact filed}: {regex} {replacement}

attr.name: zimbraBackupMinFreeSpace
attr.desc: Minimum percentage or TB/GB/MB/KB/bytes of free space on backup target to allow a full or auto-grouped backup to start; 0 = no minimum is enforced. Examples: 25%, 10GB

attr.name: zimbraGalLdapGroupHandlerClass
attr.desc: the handler class for mapping groups from GAL source to zimbra GAL contacts

attr.name: zimbraAdminImapImportNumThreads
attr.desc: number of admin initiated imap import handler threads

attr.name: zimbraMilterBindPort
attr.desc: port number on which milter server should listen

attr.name: zimbraMilterBindAddress
attr.desc: interface address(es) on which milter server should listen; if not specified, binds to 127.0.0.1

attr.name: zimbraMilterServerEnabled
attr.desc: whether milter server is enabled for a given server

attr.name: zimbraMailPurgeUseChangeDateForSpam
attr.desc: If TRUE, a message is purged from Spam based on the date that it was moved to the Spam folder. If FALSE, a message is purged from Spam based on the date that it was added to the mailbox.

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthEnabled
attr.desc: whether spnego SSO is enabled

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthRealm
attr.desc: spnego auth realm

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthKDC
attr.desc: ip or hostname for spnego auth KDC

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthAdminServer
attr.desc: ip or hostname for spnego auth admin server

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthPrincipal
attr.desc: spnego auth principal

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthTargetName
attr.desc: spnego auth target name

attr.name: zimbraSpnegoAuthErrorURL
attr.desc: spnego auth error URL

attr.name: zimbraPrefForwardReplySignatureId
attr.desc: forword/reply signature id for account/identity/dataSource

attr.name: zimbraDataSourceIsInternal
attr.desc: If TRUE, the data source is hidden from the UI.

attr.name: zimbraFeatureMAPIConnectorEnabled
attr.desc: enable/disable MAPI (Microsoft Outlook) Connector

attr.name: zimbraDumpsterEnabled
attr.desc: enable/disable dumpster

attr.name: zimbraPrefMailSignatureContactId
attr.desc: contact id associated with the signature

attr.name: zimbraMailOutgoingSieveScript
attr.desc: sieve script generated from user outgoing filter rules

attr.name: zimbraOAuthConsumerCredentails
attr.desc: OAuth consumer ids and password. It is in the format of {consumer id]:{password}

attr.name: zimbraReverseProxyUseExternalRouteIfAccountNotExist
attr.desc: Use external route configured on doamin if account cannot be found. Also see zimbraReverseProxyUseExternalRoute.
